Mr Al-Aziz is becoming well known in his city and he has started selling to schools, mosques and Islamic education centres.  Mr Al-Aziz: “Using the previous KIVA loan I was able to get new clients and increase my visibility“. He is now selling through 3 direct sales kiosks that he rents or shares with others. Besides he has a network of 3 sub agents that buy from him. Besides drinking water filters, Al-Aziz also sells Nazava water filters that make very murky and stinky water clear so that it can be used for washing. “Everybody has a different source of water here, so I need large amount of stock in order to be able to satisfy everybody”, says Al-Aziz. 

With help of KIVA credit Mr. Aziz can have a greater stock with a larger variety of filters which means that he can help a larger number of households with their pressing drinking water problems. By supporting Mr. Al-Aziz, not only his business will be strengthened. More families will have access to safe and affordable drinking water and these families will also save money and increase their disposable income. The Reseller Support Team from Nazava will do a couple of joint promotions in the coming months. Besides Aziz will place advertisements in local news papers and will also try to advertise Nazava through the local radio stations.

loans.use: to further expand the sales of drinking water filters

loans.name: Oyunaa

texts.en: Oyunaa is 51 years old, lives with her husband and has five children in "Ger" (a traditional nomadic tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Nasanjargal, works at a local company as a driver. Her two older children work at local companies, another two children are university students and the youngest son is a secondary school student. Oyunaa has been working as a cobbler at a local company for years and started her own business at home in 1981. She has years of experience and regular customers. She is planning on building a decent house to live in on their plot of land and is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase construction, insulation and other materials to build a decent house for family use. Since all of her children are grown, they need a little bit more space, and they can stay warm with less coal and firewood consumption during the Mongolian harsh and cold winter.

loans.use: to purchase construction, insulation and other materials to build a decent house for family use.

loans.name: Djebeleton  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  DJEBELETON 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à TAMARO, un des villages de la commune de DAH cercle de SAN de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3eme prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  KADIA, 1ere femme debout  de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djebeleton 3 group are married women. On average, they are 46 years old and have six children. They all live in traditional families in Tamaro, one of the villages in Dah in the San cercle (in the 4th administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to maintain their farming activities over the rainy season and this is their third loan with the institution. The previous loan was repaid in full.

Kadia, pictured standing on the far left, grows groundnuts. She will use her loan to buy farm inputs, seed and minor agricultural equipment, as well as pay the labour costs to maintain 1.5 hectares. 

After harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in San, to both men and women customers. Kadia is hoping to make 120 500 CFA francs by the end of the campaign. This money will help her to pay off the loan and help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and the purchase of farm inputs, minor agricultural equipment and seed.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FOKABEN ont en moyenne 27 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA chef lieu de commune du cercle de SAN de la  quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente d’habits, la restauration et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe FOKABEN sont à leur 5e  prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 2 eme femme de la droite  vers la compte utiliser son prêt pour faire  la vente de produits agricoles. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de petits mil 3 sacs de mais 60 kg de haricot.
 Elles s’approvisionnent à KIMPARANA et les villages environnants. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à KIMPARANA, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Fokaben group are 27 years old on average, and have an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana, an administrative centre in the cercle of San (in the 4th administrative region of Mali).

The women are all related and their business activities include trading clothing, catering and dealing in various other products. This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women in the Fokaben group. 

Djeneba, pictured second from the right, intends to use her loan to sell farm produce. She is hoping to buy two sacks of pearl millet, three sacks of maize and 60 kg of beans.

The women buy their supplies in Kimparana and the surrounding villages. They sell their goods locally in Kimparana to both men and women customers.

They are hoping to make a monthly average of 30 500 CFA francs, which will be spent on healthcare, food, school fees and reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy farm produce.

loans.name: Mardoqueo

texts.es:
Mardoqueo, es un joven muy emprendedor de 27 años,  que desde que era niño le ha gustado el trabajo de campo cultivando la tierra y cuidando del ganado. Actualmente, esta acompañado; su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar a su pequeño hijo de un año, él se esfuerza para salir con todos los trabajos a tiempo y así dedicarle también mucha atención a su familia.

Las labores agrícolas, las aprendió de su padre quien fue el pionero en enseñarle esta fuente de trabajo, debido a los escasos recursos económicos con los que contaban. En estos momentos, Mardoqueo trabaja como corralero por la mañana y en la tarde se dedica a cultivar la tierra, para tener los granos necesarios con los cuales podrá dar el alimento a su familia. Debe de trasladarse durante unos 25 minutos hacia los corrales donde esta el ganado de su patrono, este viaje lo realiza en motocicleta, ya que a pie tendría que caminar mas de 1 hora, viaja con el hermano, pues él también trabaja con el mismo patrono.
 
Con el crédito comprara abono para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, así también como los herbicidas para el trato de la maleza, esta inversión ronda los $300, el resto del dinero será para pagar mano de obra de las personas que le ayudaran durante todo el proceso de trato de cultivo. De esta manera, estará asegurando tener la ayuda necesaria para realizar todos sus trabajos a tiempo, además el costo de compra y traslado será mas bajo ya que lo comprara todo de una sola vez.

En un futuro quiere que su hijo sea una persona que le guste trabajar muy duro, para dar el sustento a su familia, además lo quiere ver crecer en una comunidad libre de delincuencia y sin problemas con los vecinos, que se encamine por caminos religiosos.
texts.en:
Mardoqueo is a young, 27-year-old entrepreneur. Since he was a child, he has enjoyed working in the country, cultivating land and raising livestock. Currently, he has a common-law wife. His life partner works in the home and cares for their one-year-old son. Mardoqueo makes an effort to finish all of his work on time, so he is able to dedicate a lot of time to his family.

He learned the agricultural trade from his father, who was a pioneer in teaching him this employment source, due to the scarce resources that they had. Currently, Mardoqueo works as a herder in the morning and, in the afternoons, he farms to have the necessary grains with which he can nourish his family. He has to travel some 25 minutes to the corrals where his employer's livestock is. He makes this trip on a motorcycle, since it would take him over an hour to walk there. He travels with his brother, who works for the same employer.
 
With the loan, he will buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops. He will alsp purchase herbicides to treat the weeds. This investment will cost around $300. The rest of the money will be used to pay laborers that help him through the cultivation process. This way, he will be sure that he will have the help necessary to complete all of his work on time. Additionally, the cost of purchasing and transporting the goods will be lower since he will buy everything at once.

In the future, he hopes that his son will become a person who likes to work hard to provide for his family. He also wants to see his son grow up in a community free of crime and without problems with his neighbors, and that he takes a religious path.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops, herbicides to treat the weeds, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, seis hijos, dos nietos y dos nueras, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra ya que el cultiva maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de sus hijos logran solventar los gasto del hogar, don narciso está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con su siembra ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Narciso is 65 and lives in his own home with his wife, six children, two grandchildren and two daughters-in-law. He has worked in agriculture for a number of years. His children help him in the cultivation of corn and beans, and he sells his produce at a commodities exchange. With the money he earns and the help of his children he is able to pay the household expenses. Narciso is asking for a loan to buy weed killer, fertilisers, seeds and pesticides which will allow him to carry on growing his crops, his only source of work, and thereby continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, fertilisers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Don Adan de 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica hace 3 años al cultivo de plátano, maíz, y frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Adan solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de plátanos como: cepas, foliares y fertilizantes y así seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Adan is 65 and lives in his own house with his partner and his son. For three years he has worked cultivating bananas, corn and beans. With the money he earns he is able to pay the household expenses. Adan is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies for growing bananas, including banana plants and fertilisers, which will allow him to continue with his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: comprar cepas, foliares y fertilizantes

loans.name: Aracely Elizabet

texts.es: Doña aracely de  33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos,  es una mujer trabajadora y muy eficaz en sus labores  es responsable en sus ocupaciones, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y caña de azúcar desde hace varios años por esa razón cuenta con una gran experiencia en las actividades que realiza, aracely está solicitando un  crédito para poderlo invertir en capital del trabajo  comprando semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y asi aumentar los  ingresos para su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Aracely is 33 and lives with her partner and three children. She is a hardworking, efficient and responsible woman. She has been growing corn, beans and sugar cane for a number of years and has a good deal of experience in this area. Aracely is asking for a loan to invest in buying seeds, fertiliser, weed-killer and pesticides for her business, which will allow her to increase her income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, weed-killer and pesticides.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Alejandro y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años, esta actividad le dio el dinero necesario para poner su tienda, la cual le esta dando muy buenas ganancias, ya que no hay muchas en su pueblo, convirtiéndose poco a poco en su actividad principal. Lo que más le gusta de tener la tienda es conversar con sus vecinos cuando entran a  comprarle algo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su tienda todo el día. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Rosa, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como leche, arroz, azúcar, entre otros para así abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, is a very loving, hardworking mother living in her own house with her husband, Alejandro, and their four children for whom she wants to provide a better future.  

Rosa works in agriculture having learned to work the land while still very young since agriculture has been her family’s occupation for many years.  This activity provided her with the money needed to set up her store which has been producing very good profits because there aren’t many stores in her town.  It’s gradually become her main activity.

What she likes about having the store is chatting with her neighbors when they come in to buy something.  She’s been doing this for five years and considers the hardest part having to stay in the store all day.   In time, she’d like to expand the store’s installations to provide more comfort for her customers.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets in order to continue forward.  In addition, she commits to make her payments punctually.

Rosa will use the 500 soles to buy food items like milk, rice and sugar, among others to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty Kyrey significa grupo de mujeres con entusiasmo en el idioma guaraní, está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy escasos.
Myrian es parte de este entusiasta grupo, está contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que por medio de las capacitaciones ha ido mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, desde muy tempranas horas todos los días de la semana. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche, para poder seguir con sus ventas y seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Kuña Aty Kyrey” means “Group of Enthusiastic Women” in the Guaraní language.  This group is in its eighth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program, in which the members work and help one another move forward.  They have taken a poverty elimination survey, which indicated that eight of the members are below the poverty line.  In other words, they have very scarce incomes.  

Myrian is pleased to be part of this enthusiastic group.  She has been improving as a result of the training she has received.  Myrian sells milk during the early morning hours, every day of the week.  She is a hardworking woman who strives to get ahead.  Myrian is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of milk.  This will allow her to continue her sales and keep satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 40 years old and married with four children.

Mary Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, milk, soap, sugar and coffee.

Mary Joy has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from charcoal and rice retailing businesses.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, milk, soap, sugar and coffee, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don Manuel de  35 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, su madre y su hijo, hace 6 años se dedica al cultivo de plátano, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Manuel solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de plátano como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi seguir con sus siembras para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 35, lives in his own house with his wife, his mother, and his child.  He has been growing bananas for six years.  This is how he gets income to manage to pay some of the household expenses.  

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his banana crops.  He will buy things like fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.  This way he will continue with his crops in order to get better income and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is married with three children, and two of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She sells green bananas and has been in this business for five years.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income through selling piped water and charcoal.  She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to earn enough profit to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali  ont  en moyenne 39  ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier de Santoro II  de la ville de San, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments  et de diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2e  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés le prêt précédent
Madame SANATA   présidente de l’association (1 ère debout de la droite vers la gauche) excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier  de Santoro  et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 douzaines de cartons Maggi de tous genres, un sac de sel, 3 kg de l’ail, un panier de tomates fraiches et  2 kg de poivre  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame SANATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 16500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Most of them married in traditional extended families, the four women of the group Sabali average 39 years of age and three children each. The women all live in the Santoro II district of San City, in Région de Ségou(4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community and kinship and through their professional work. They buy and sell condiments and a variety of merchandise.

With the goal of satisfying their burgeoning customer base, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. The previous loans were correctly paid back. 

Ms. SANATA (standing first from the right in the photo) is the association's president. She excels in selling condiments. She is in high demand in and around the Santoro district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 6 dozen boxes of Maggi of all kinds, a bag of salt, 3 kg of garlic, a basket of fresh tomatoes, and 2 kg of black pepper. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a mixed customer base. 

With this loan, Ms. SANATA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 16,500 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and helping her husband to meet household needs.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 51-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. For 20 years, he has been in the agriculture sector and also buys produce from other farmers to meet the high demand.

Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and set up sustainable income generating activities to secure their future.

Unpredictable weather changes are his major hindrance to growth, while his desire is to become a model farmer.

Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his garden.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 49 years old, is from the village of Union in Isabela. She is married with three grown up children, and she is a very lovable and jolly person.

Josefina has been engaged in hog-raising for eight years with the help of her husband.  After four months, she sell the pigs to the buyers.  

She dreams of expanding her business, but doesn't have enough capital for the maintenance of the business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a supply of hog feed.

loans.use: to buy a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Rene Luis

texts.es:
Rene tiene 27 años de edad. Cada día Rene trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante, es por ello que para poder solventar sus gastos trabaja como repartidor en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, Rene trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; Rene cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Rene está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar artículos para su hogar como ollas, platos y demás enseres, ya que actualmente no los tiene, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rene, age 27, works very hard every day in order to be able to get ahead.  He works as a delivery man for a small company in his city so that he is able to pay his expenses.  Rene works around ten hours a day.  Rene believes that he is getting ahead in his work because he is responsible and friendly with the customers.

Rene is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy household items like pots, plates, and other good that he does not currently have.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  He will continue struggling to make his biggest dream come true.  He dreams of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Kotognogotala  ont en moyenne 44ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou  un des quartiers de la ville de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la teinture.
les femmes du groupe Kotognogotala sont à leur 7 e prêt solidaire les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourses. Fatoumata débout   au milieu  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des balles de bazin pour les teinter avant de les mettre sur le marché   Elles s’approvisionnent à BAMAKO. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à SAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Kotognogotala average 44 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a district in SAN City, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through ties of kinship and through their work buying and selling grocery items, such as condiments, and the dyeing of fabrics.

The women of the group Kotognogotala are on their seventh solidarity loan. The previous loans were correctly paid back.

Fatoumata, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase bales of damask fabrics to dye and then put up for sale. She gets her supplies in BAMAKO. She makes her sales to men and women customers locally in SAN. Fatoumata envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,5000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling costs, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase damask fabrics to dye

loans.name: Dashbalburmaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Dashbalburmaa is 31 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter Tsolmontuya is 7 and a primary school student; her younger two daughters, Mongontuya and Nomintuya, go to a local kindergarten. 

Dashbalburmaa used to run a spare parts retail in the local market for two years, until 2010. She has been working as saleswoman in a local market clothes retail shop since then. She has gained a lot of experience, and is now starting her own business of retail clothing in a rental counter of the local market. 

She is requesting 1,400,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory from Erlian, China to sell at her counter. 

She is a hardworking and strong woman who says, "It is little hard being a single mother with three young daughters, but I am trying my best to raise my children to be good people."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory from Erlian, China to sell at her counter

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has a retail shop in Kangundo town and has been in the business for eight years. He is 37 years old and married, with six children. His wife also provides income to support the family. 

This is his fourth loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include maize and wheat flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and cooking fat, as well as bars of soap and detergents. He anticipates making more income, which he will use to stock his shop with animal feed to sell due to its high demand in the area.

Charles hopes to open another retail shop, make more income and be able to educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Hard work and patience have been Romeo's guiding principles in managing his transportation business. He is now 49 years of age and married with three children. Two of his children are already married while the other one is still studying.

Romeo has operated his transportation business for two years now. He aims to earn better income and let his child finish his studies. In order to obtain this goal, he decided to request additional capital of 5,000 PHP which will allow him to buy two new wheels for his motorcycle transport. With this, he will able to keep his passengers safe as he transports them to their destinations. He hopes that the loan he requested will be approved.

loans.use: to buy two new wheels for his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Silvia Luz

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer de 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y actualmente es separada. Hace 19 años se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió empíricamente; trabajó como operaria en varios talleres, donde perfeccionó su técnica y obtuvo más conocimientos del oficio. Toda esta experiencia y conocimientos adquiridos, le permitieron iniciar su propio negocio, un taller que ubicó en su casa, donde comenzó a confeccionar su línea propia de pijamas y blusas para dama y conjuntos deportivos. Silvia ha tenido que enfrentar varios inconvenientes, pues en la zona donde se encuentra ubicada, existen bandas criminales que están pendientes de la actividad de los comerciantes para cobrar vacunas y extorsiones, por lo que tuvo que prescindir de las empleadas que le ayudaban y bajar el ritmo de producción, pues pasó de laborar toda la semana en su taller, a hacerlo sólo los fines de semana, y complementar sus ingresos trabajando como operaria de otro taller durante la semana; todo esto, porque se vio obligada a manejar un bajo perfil para no correr más peligros con el grupo delicuencial.  Actualmente, la cliente solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, elásticos) aprovechando los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado, lo que le permitirá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar la producción, ya que en el segundo semestre del año le realizan muy buenos pedidos, por lo tanto incrementa sus ingresos. Esto le permite soñar con cumplir el sueño de abrir un almacén a mediano plazo, en el que pueda comercializar sus productos y volver a generar oportunidades de empleo, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y la de muchas otras personas que influyen en el desarrollo de su labor.
texts.en:
Silvia’s a 42-year-old woman; she has two children and is separated at the moment.  She’s worked for 10 years sewing clothes, an activity she learned empirically.  She worked as an employee in several workshops where she perfected her techniques and acquired more occupational skills.  All of this experience and knowledge acquired led to her being able to open her own business: a home-based workshop where she started to make her own line of pajamas, women’s blouses and athletic wear.

Silvia has had to face several problems because there are several criminal gangs in the zone where she’s located that extort and charge protection fees from merchants which led to her having to dismiss her employees that helped her and decrease her level of production.  She changed from working all week in her workshop to just doing so on weekends and added to her income by being employed as an operator in another shop during the week.  She did all this because she was forced to lower her profile to avoid being subject to any more danger from the criminal gangs.

She’s currently requesting a loan to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, elastic) taking advantage of available discounts for cash sales which will make it possible for her to have more variety to offer her customers and thus increase production since the second semester of the year means more orders that increase her income.

This allows her to dream with reaching her goal of opening a store in the medium run where she can sell her products and once again generate employment opportunities improving the quality of life of her family and of many others who take part in her work’s development.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a widow who lives in Kanoni where she operates her business. She is an agriculturalist who farms and raises goats on a small scale. She also sells firewood, locally weaved mats and green bananas to get income to pay school fees for her dependents. Sylivia wishes to get a loan to buy goats and green bananas in bulk, especially in this season when the food is cheap in the rural area. She will sell to people who take to them to the city so that she can get increased profits. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy goats and green bananas

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida de 51 años y sus nueve hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como  granos básicos, pan, lácteos, jabones entren otros, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y con el tiempo ha logrado obtener algunas ganancias pues ahorra varios costos porque su compañero de vida que es jornalero le aporta los granos básicos frijoles y maíz, además de estas cosechas comercian en diferentes lugares para complementar los gastos del hogar, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene  buenos precios, con producto de calidad, y un servicio  excelente; Elsa es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para salir adelante, lo mas impórtate para ella es la familia, aunque ha sido difícil sostenerla porque es muy extensa siempre ha luchado por darles lo que necesitan; dentro de poco quiere empezar los trabajos para colocar luz eléctrica en el hogar además de colocar un baño y un lavadero pues todo es muy indispensable para mas comodidad y una vida mas completa. Necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita un crédito a FUSAI que le permita comprar cemento, cables, focos, arena, un sanitario etc. Elsa tiene buenas referencias de pago de parte de sus conocidos,  se hace responsable junto a su esposo de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and lives with her life partner, age 51. They have nine children. Elsa has a store where she sells basic necessities such as grains, bread, dairy products, soap, and other products. She has several years of experience in this business and over time has set aside some of her earnings for various expenses. Her partner is a day laborer who grows basic grains, beans, and corn. These crops are sold in different places so that they can pay for the household expenses. Elsa has many customers who prefer to do business with her because she offers quality products at good prices and provides excellent service. She is devoted to her work and willing to do everything that she can to succeed. What is most important to her is her family, but supporting them can be difficult since her family is so large. However, she always strives to provide them with what they need.

Very soon, Elsa would like to begin installing electric lights in her home, as well as a bathroom and washroom. These are essential for having a more comfortable and fuller life. She needs to make this investment, but she does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, Elsa is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, cables, light bulbs, sand, a toilet, and other items. She has good payment references from those who know her. Elsa and her husband will be responsible for repaying this debt. At the same time, they have faith that they can provide their family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, cables, light bulbs, sand, a toilet, and other items.

loans.name: Mbene's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Elle font toutes le commerce. Mbéne est la représentante du groupe elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 garçon et 3 filles qui ont de 36 à 13 ans. Elle fait du commerce et compte acheter avec son prêt 100000f de tissu,100000f de sac a main et de chaussure  et 50000f de bijoux et 50000f de pain de singe, bissap sucre etc.Avec ses bénéfices elles épargne dans le Banc villageois et dans un compte ouvert dans une autre institution.Elle assure aussi ses dépenses journalières.
texts.en:
This group comprises five women who live in the same district and who have good social cohesion. They all work in commerce. Mbéne is the group's representative. She is a widow and mother of four children, a son and three daughters, who are 13 to 36 years old. 

Mbéne has a business and intends to use her loan to purchase 100,000 francs of cloth, 100,000 f of handbags and shoes, 50,000 f of jewelry, 50,000 f of monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), dried hibiscus flowers, sugar, etc. With the profits she saves at the 'banc villageois' and at an open account in another institution, she is sure to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, handbags, shoes, jewelry, 'monkey bread', hibiscus flowers, sugar, etc...

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her education fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fee and other school expenses in Ulaanbaatar city

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 26 years of age, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children currently go to school while her youngest child is still an infant. With her husband, they work together to continue send their children to school and have financial stability.

To buy a new side car for the motorcycle transport they use for business, Leonida is requesting for loan of PHP 5,000. In this way, she can also ensure the safety of her passengers. She hopes for the approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy a new side car for her motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en: Laban is a farmer who grows tea in his local cell. He has done this since 1998 with a motive of getting a source of income to meet his family's needs. He has 13 children and money from the tea business provides for all their needs. He devotes to the business seven hours per day and his hard work has helped him improve the quality harvested every month. His clients are mainly tea traders in the area and his major challenge is weather which affects his tea crop negatively and hence affects the income derived in a given period. Laban intends to use the UGX 500,000 (five hundred thousand) loan he applied for to buy fertilizer for his tea farm so he can harvest much more. The photo shows Laban on his tea farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his tea farm.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don  José de 34 años de edad  vive en casa alquila con su esposa y sus tres hijos , es un hombre muy trabajador que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia con esmero y mucho empeño  se  esfuerza día a día  para salir adelante, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, José está solicitando un crédito  para poder comprar fertilizantes abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y de esa manera poder incrementar sus ingresos con los cuales solventa algunos de los gastos de su familia y así mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 34, lives in a rented house with his wife and three children.  He’s a very hard working man who strives daily with much effort and dedication to move his family forward.

He has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans for fifteen years and has gained the necessary experience to care for his crops.  José is requesting a loan to be able to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, herbicide, pesticide, etc. to increase his income that he uses to cover some of his family expenses to thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Yao Bernard

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yao a fait une formation en cuisine. Voyant que les activités ne prospère pas comme il le souhaite, il a commencé la vente des céréales plus précisément le maïs en 2007. Il revend à domicile et au marché. Son troisième prêt lui permettra d'acheter des sacs de maïs afin de répondre au besoin des clients.  Comme perspectives d'avenir, mr Yao espère devenir un gros distributeur et bien assurer le rôle de responsable de famille. Marié, il a 02 enfants âgés de 07 et 04ans qui continuent leurs études. Il est quant à lui âgé de 37ans.
texts.en: Mr. Yao has trained to be a cook. Seeing that his work was not as prosperous as he would like it to be, he started selling grains, corn to be exact, in 2007. He sells out of his home and at the market. His third loan will enable him to purchase sacks of corn to meet customer needs. For the future, Mr. Yao hopes to become a wholesale distributor and to fulfill with surety his role as head of household. He is married and has two children, 7 and 4 years old, who are still in school. As for himself, he is 37 years old.

loans.use: to purchase oil, tomatoes, rice, and various other goods to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris le métier de la tresse, mais ne gagnant pas suffisamment de revenu de son activité, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de détail de mèches. Cela lui permet de gagner un meilleur revenu. Elle a une ancienneté de 11ans dans ce commerce et le fait de façon ambulante. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Voulant reconstituer son stock qui s’épuise, elle sollicite de WAGES un cinquième crédit pour acheter une trentaine de mèches et divers. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 10ans scolarisé. Elle espère devenir grossiste et créer une boutique.
texts.en: This women learned how to sell braids, but not earning enough income from it, she got started in selling hair extensions at the retail level. This enables her to earn a better income. She has eleven years of seniority in this business and operates door to door. She gets her supplies at the big market in Lomé. Wanting to rebuild her shrinking inventory, she is requesting a fifth loan from WAGES to purchase about 30 hair extensions and more. She is married and a mother of a 10-year-old child, who is in school. She hopes to become a wholesale merchant and to establish a store.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional nomadic tent in Ger, Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Oyunchimeg's husband, Hurelbaatar, helps her to run their clothing retail business in the local market. Her older daughter graduated from university and works at a local company in Ulaanbaatar city. Her son Zolboo studies IT engineering at university and is planning to provide a video game center in town since he can install the necessary programs and games and fix the computers if they have problems. Oyunchimeg's youngest son, Tengis, is 13 and a secondary school student. Oyunchimeg and her husband started their clothes retail business in the local market in 2003 and have regular customers and suppliers. Oyunchimeg is requesting a loan of 4,600,000 MNT to purchase 30 computers to help her son to start his own business of video game center in town. Hurelbaatar and Oyunchimeg are very supportive of their children and their ideas.

loans.use: to purchase 30 computers to help her son to start a video game business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta cuenta con valores morales y espirituales, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cultivar la tierra junto a su compañero de vida, ambos son personas que desde su niñez les ha gustado trabajar muy duro, para llevar el sustento a su familia y que no les falte nada.  Para trasladarse a sus cultivos ella junto a su compañero de vida tienen que caminar 30 minutos y se tienen que atravesar el río; ya que sus cultivos están del otro lado, ella ha tenido 3 hijos pero ya están viviendo separados de ella, todos trabajan. Actualmente ella tiene 41 años de edad.

Ella proviene de una  familia de escasos recursos económicos y tenían que trabajar todos para llevar el sustento a la casa, de esta manera es como ella aprendió las actividades agrícolas.  Además, para colaborar con un ingreso extra para la familia hace ventas de antojitos los días que hay partidos de futbol en la cancha de la comunidad. 

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, ya que tiene cultivada 7,000 metros cuadrados y esto les genera un buen gasto en insumos agrícolas, pero si los compra de una sola vez, tiene un pequeño ahorro en dinero y en tiempo; ya que le sale mas barato y solo hace un viaje para comprar, debido a que la zona donde vive es rural y las carreteras están en mal estado no hay transporte publico así que tiene que pagar un vehículo que le realice  el viaje con las compras.

Ella desea que sus esfuerzos no sean en vano y obtener una buena cosecha de granos; ya que esto le ayudara mucho en la economía para la temporada donde no se puede cultivar, desea conocer a sus nietos y poder verlos crecer en un mundo donde puedan vivir sanamente, libres de cualquier problema y que sean personas de trabajo en la comunidad donde ellos residen.
texts.en:
María’s a very hardworking, honest person with good moral and spiritual values.  She works taking care of her home and cultivating the land alongside her life companion.  They are both people who have liked to work very hard since childhood to provide sustenance for their family and so that they will lack nothing.  To head to her farmland she and her life companion must walk 30 minutes and ford the river since their farmland is on the other side.  She’s had three children but they no longer live with her; all are working.  She’s currently 41-years-old.

She comes from a family of very scarce economic resources; they all had to work in order to provide sustenance at home.  This is how she learned the agricultural chores.  Also, in order to earn extra family income she makes snacks on days when there are soccer games in the local community field.

The requested loan is to buy manure and fertilizer for the corn and bean crops because she has 7,000 square meters planted which generates a substantial cost in agricultural supplies.  However, if she’s able to buy them all at once she saves a little money and time because she can get them cheaper and only has to take one trip to buy them because she lives in a rural zone with very bad roads and no public transportation; she has to pay a vehicle in order to make the trip with her purchases.

She hopes that her efforts won’t be in vain and to obtain a good crop yield of grains because this will be of great economic help to her during the season when it’s not possible to cultivate.  She’d like to get to know her grandchildren and to be able to see them grow up in a world where they can live healthfully free of problems and that they become working people in the communities where they live.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 27 years old and married to David; they have been blessed with four children between the ages of 10 and 5. 

Jackline runs an electronic shop in Ahero in Kisumu county and she is served by the Kadet Ltd Kapsabet branch. She has been in this business for the last ten years.

From this business she gets an average monthly income of Kshs 70,000. She has taken a loan of kshs 45,000 from Kadet; this is her second loan after successful repaying her first loan. 

She plans to use the whole amount to purchase more electronics (i.e water heaters, multi-plug cables, sockets, switches among other items). 

She anticipates getting profits.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a clothing inventory before the academic year starts in order to increase their sales

loans.name: Ouynchimeg

texts.en:
Ouynchimeg is 35 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii in the province of Mongolia. Her husband, Ganzorig, is partly disabled, receives a small amount of pension from the government, is currently unemployed and looking for job. Her two sons attend local secondary and primary school. 

Ouynchimeg started her grocery shop on her plot of land near public schools in 2010 and is already well-known on the street with her good service and qualified products. Her husband helps her to purchase inventory from the local market and transport it to their small shop. She is now requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to sell during her high season of academic year starts. She is a hardworking, diligent and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to sell during her high season of academic year starts.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es: Don José vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde  hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de donde el reside, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son frescos y a buen precio, Don José  solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles, de plagas, etc. Con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José lives with his family group in his own house.  He has worked growing corn for several years earning profits to cover some of his household expenses.  He sells his products in areas around where he lives.  He has a large clientele because his products are fresh and well-priced.  José’s requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, manure, herbicide, pest control, etc.  He hopes with this to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Linda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Linda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Ma. Linda has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Ma. Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ndeye Khady's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartiers et fonts toutes le commerce. Ndeye Khady est la représentante du groupe et est placée a l’extrême droite de la photo,elle est mariée et mère de 3 filles de 38;36; et 24 ans et 1 garçon de 32 ans.Elle fait du commerce de produit halieutique et a une expérience de 10 ans .Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des produits halieutique a 200000f et des savons ,eau de javel et boubou a 100000f. Elle mène son activité chez elle.Avec ses bénéfices elle gère bien sa famille et aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison(frais médicaux,nourriture etc...
texts.en: This group is made up of five women who live in the same area and all have businesses. Ndeye Khady is the group's representative and is on the far right of the photo. She is married and the mother of three daughters, ages 38, 36, and 24, and one son who is 32. She sells fishing products and has ten years of experience. With her loan she plans to buy 200000 francs worth of fishing products, and 100000 francs worth of soap, bleach, and long dresses (boubous). She runs her business from her home. With her profits, she manages her family well and helps her husband with the household expenses (medical costs, food, etc.)

loans.use: to buy 200000 francs worth of fishing products, and 100000 francs worth of soap, bleach, and long dresses (boubous)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe BENKADI ont  en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes SIENSO dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de divers  de tasses plastiques et de fruits et légumes. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  11eme  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts  précédents.
Madame AWA  présidente de l’association 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche photo) excelle dans la vente de  d’articles divers. Elle est très sollicitée à SIENSO et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande  quantité de mil, de petit mil, de maïs, de Soumbala et de la potasse pour la cuisine. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame AWA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 47000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Wives who mainly come from traditional extended families, the four women in the Benkadi group are, on average, 35 years old with four children. They all live in Sienso in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali) and met through neighbors, business, and family ties. They buy and sell various items, plastic cups, and fruits and vegetables. With the goal of satisfying their customers who are more and more numerous and demanding, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their eleventh group loan, having repaid in full their previous loans.

Madame Awa, the group's president, is the woman standing up on the right in the photo. She excels in sales of various items. She is on demand in Sienso and the surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of two types of millet, corn, sumbala (a condiment), and potash. She does her retail sales in cash and on credit to a mixed base of customers. With this loan, Madame Awa hopes to earn a monthly profit of 47000 CFA francs, which will be used for reinvestment in her business and to help her husband take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: Este cliente trabaja en Chinandega en este negocio desde hace 9 años, es soltero, tiene una hija que depende de él, quien está en edad escolar, actualmente su hija cursa el segundo grado de primaria, este joven se inicio en este negocio como ayudante, con la experiencia adquirida, con el tiempo y con un espiritu emprendedor decidio establecer su propio negocio, el prestamo lo utilizara en la compra de Materia Prima para fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en: This client works in Chinandega and has had his business for nine years.  He is single and has a school-aged daughter who is dependent on him.  She is currently in her second year of primary school.  This young man started in this line of work as a helper, and with the experience he acquired, with time and with his entrepreneurial spirit, he decided to open his own business.  He will use the loan to purchase raw materials to strengthen his business.

loans.use: with raw materials to use in business, like bond paper, tape, ink, card stock and reams of paper.

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE CHUSO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silveriana ella es casada y tiene 39 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de animales, la socia cría las gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maíz y papa, por medio de estos pequeño negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the Virgen Natividad de Chuso Community Bank located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Silveriana. She is 39 years old, married and has five children. She earns her living raising and then selling chickens in various markets. Silveriana is also a farmer and grows corn and potatoes on her land. Through these two small businesses she supports her children.

Silveriana's dream is to have a stall from where she can sell the chickens. With the loan money she plans to buy chickens.

The two people whose photos were added later were not present for the group photo. They were excused for reasons of work. Group members are engaged in such work as selling food, selling animals, grocery store, and farming.

Silveriana is grateful to those who contribute to this loan and help her fulfill her dream. She promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es: Doña Maria de 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de 19, 15, y 12 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace 4 años posee su propia tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su tienda: bebidas, golosinas, granos básicos, aceites, azúcar, sopas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives in her own house with her life partner and her children, ages 19, 15, and 12, who are currently in school.  She has had her own store for four years and manages to pay some of her household expenses with her earnings.

María's requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store: beverages, sweets, basic grains, oil, sugar, soup, etc.  With this she hopes to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is very thankful for the financial assistance given to her. She used her loan as additional capital for her business. Her business is continuously growing, and it has been running for more than ten years now. Her income from her business has assisted with her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia hopes that her business will continue to flourish and that more products will be added. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es: Don Santos vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, hace 8 años se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol,  comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Santos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. para seguir con sus siembras y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his own house with his life partner and his children.

He has made a living growing corn and beans for eight years and is able to pay some of his household expenses with his earnings.  He sells his crops in the markets near his house.

Santos is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs: seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, herbicide, pest control, etc.  He wants to continue with his fields and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Jorge Jefferson

texts.es:
Jefferson de 21 años trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos para fiestas, como piñatas, globos, disfraces, entre otros; Jefferson labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede llegar a atender hasta 10  clientes al día; Jefferson cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos novedosos.

Jefferson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar globos al por mayor, piñatas, disfraces, pelucas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un negocio mucho más grande”.
texts.en:
Jefferson, who is 21 years old, works in his small business selling party supplies, like piñatas, balloons and costumes, among others.  Jefferson works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers a day.  

Jefferson believes that he is getting ahead in his business because he is friendly with his customers and above all, because he offers novel products.

Jefferson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy wholesale balloons, piñatas, costumes, wigs, and other items, which will allow him to continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality:  "To have his own house and to have a much bigger business."

loans.use: to buy party supplies.

loans.name: Rital Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer con mucho carisma y entusiasmo, tiene 40 años y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener su negocio de salón de belleza, en el cual trabaja con mucho cariño y dedicación, Rita labora alrededor de 10 horas y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día, Rita cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Rita está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar equipo para su peluquería como secadoras, planchas de cabello, cepillos especiales, entre otros, de esta manera podra tener los materiales necesarios para poder atender a sus clientes y de esta manera seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño de : Tener un gran spa”.
texts.en:
Rita is a woman with a lot of charisma and enthusiasm.  She is 40 years old and through great effort, she has succeeded in having her own beauty salon, in which she works with a lot of care and dedication.  

Rita works around 10 hours and can attend to up to 15 customers a day.  Rita believes that things are going well in her business because she is very friendly with her customers.  

Rita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she will be able to buy equipment for her salon like hairdryers, hair irons, special brushes, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to have the necessary materials to tend to her customers and to continue striving to make her great dream a reality:  To have a big spa.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña aprendió lo necesario para cuidar de sus sembríos de alverja, lechuga y maíz, comenta que su especialidad son las hortalizas, pues ella se caracteriza por ser muy detallista y estas plantas necesitan de mucho cuidado para que no se marchiten. Es así que ahora tiene buenas ganancias en sus cosechas, por lo que adquirió su propia casa hace poco. Ahora espera mejorar sus productos pues la demanda exige ser selectivos y eso le enseñarón sus hijos mayores que también se dedican a la agricultura como ella. Afirma también que como la agricultura deja ganancias después de algunos meses, cría vacas y toros para comercializarlos entre los carniceros de la zona y eso le deja ganancias permanentes. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Antonia, invertirá los S/.2000 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Antonia, who is 42-years old, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with two of her five children in her own home.  At a very young age, she learned what she needed to know about caring for her plantings of peas, lettuce and corn.  She says that her specialty is vegetables.  She is known for being very detail-oriented, and these plants need a lot of care so they don't wither.  That is why she earns good money from her harvests and was able to buy her own home not long ago.  Now she hopes to improve her produce, as the demand requires her to be selective.  Her older sons taught her that, as they earn their livings in agriculture like Antonia.  She also states that as farming earns her money after a number of months, she raises cows and bulls to sell to the butchers in the area.  That gives her a regular source of income.  This is Antonia's first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial help she is receiving to keep working toward getting ahead.  In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually.  Antonia will invest the S/.2000 (USD $725) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Danaya  ont en moyenne 42ans, 7enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Lafiabougou  un des quartiers de la ville de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires,  et la teinture.
les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. CLAUDINE debout  au milieu  sur la photo et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de diverses marchandises 1 rouleau de tissu et des noix de néré. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les différentes foires environnantes de SAN. Elles effectuent ses ventes, sur place à SAN, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are, on average, 42 years old with seven children, and all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the areas of the city, San, in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women met each other through family ties and do business buying and selling food products such as spices and dyes.

The women in the Danaya group are on their first group loan. Claudine, standing up in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy various merchandise, including one roll of fabric and néré seeds (used to make the condiment sumbala). They stock up in the various fairs around San. She make their sales in the square in San, to a mixed customer base.
They foresee making an average monthly profit of 145,00 CFA francs, which will be used for expenditures related to health, food, and school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 47 años es una mujer soltera. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia. Cuidar a su familia siempre fue su prioridad, no se arrepiente de ello pues gracias a su buen juicio puede disfrutar de una vida tranquila. Comenta que su principal ingreso económico proviene de la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles que abrió hace 22 años, “gracias a este negocio, pude enfrentar muchos retos económicos”, afirma. Es así que ella es muy conocida en la zona, los pobladores desde muy temprano compran los alimentos del día, ella desea mejorar los productos que vende comprando nuevos alimentos, además de carne y verduras que no se encuentran en el pueblo, espera poder lograr sus objetivos.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Luz, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, leche, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
47-year old Luz is a single mother living with her parents in their own home. To care for her family has always been her priority and she has never regretted this. Thanks to her good judgment she has enjoyed a tranquil life. Luz's principal source of income comes from her grocery store which she started 22 years ago. She says, "It is thanks to this business that I have been able to overcome many financial challenges."

Luz is well known in the area. From early in the morning people buy their groceries from her. Now she wishes to offer different products such as meat and vegetables that are not found in the town and in this way reach her goals. 

This is Luz's first loan with Kiva and she hopes to continue receiving financing. She promises to pay back the money punctually. She plans to buy items such as rice, milk, and sugar with the S/.500 loan.

loans.use: Buy groceries such as rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha de 38 años, tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia a base de material rústico desde hace 15 años. Bertha es una mujer alegre y a la vez esmerada en sus labores. Hace casi 20 años que siembra papa, arveja, y maíz. “Los productos de mi localidad son buenos porque crecen sanos y fuertes”, comenta Bertha. Pero no sólo se dedica a ello, también tiene animales; vacas, cerdos y burros, estos últimos que le ayudan a trasportar el abono o también los productos que cosecha. Ahora piensa cultivar una parcela más de arvejas, pues su meta futura es mejorar su producción y venderla en otras ciudades. Sus metas del año son claras, por ello requiere sembrar más arvejas y maíz. Solicita de su apoyo para esto. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Bertha, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Bertha is 38-years old and has two children who live with her in her own home.  Her home of the last fifteen years is built of rustic materials.  Bertha is a happy woman but also conscientious in her work.  For twenty years has planted potatoes, peas and corn.  “The produce from my area is good because the plants grow strong and healthy”, says Bertha.  But she doesn't solely make her living from farming; she also has animals: cows, pigs and donkeys.  The donkeys help with transporting compost and also her harvest.  Bertha is thinking about cultivating another parcel of peas, as her future goal is to improve production and sell her produce in other cities.  Her goals for the year are clear, which is why she needs to plant more peas and corn.  This is what Bertha is requesting the loan for.  This is her fourth loan with KIVA, and she feels grateful for the financial help she is receiving to keep moving forward.  In addition, Bertha promises to make her payments punctually.  Bertha will invest the S/.2500 soles (USD $900) in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Chinchero y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Isabel ella es casada y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien graciasd al empeño que le pone cada dia asu negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poider segrui trabajando para de esta forma segrui apoyando a su fmailia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, ganadería, tienda de abarrotes,agricultura y
crianza de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Tres Barrios de Ccoricancha Communal Bank, located in the district of Chinchero in the province of Chinchero and department of Cusco.

The member, Isabel, 36, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs.  She has had the business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  Isabel raises these little animals to sell to her customers who request them.  She wants to continue working so she can support her family.

Isabel's requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

The other members sell vegetables, have a grocery store, raise animals, and work in ranching and agriculture.
 
Isabel's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old gentleman, married to Teresa. He is the father of two children, ages four and two years. He operates a food stall in the Lower side of Narok town, in a densely-populated, informal settllement area. He learned about KADET from some of his regular customers. 

He has been issued a third loan, in the amount of KES 60,000, after having successfully repaid the previous ones. He will use the funds to purchase a tent, so as to cover the outer space of his stall, especially in this cold season. This will allow him to accomondate more customers at the same time, thus earning more income.

Samuel will plough back the profits into the business, for further expansion. His dreams are to build rental houses, and to educate his children to high levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase a tent to enlarge his food stall

loans.name: Nastorio

texts.en:
Nastorio is 31 years old. He is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance who has borrowed six times from UGAFODE. He is a married man with three children aged eight, seven and one and a half. The first two go to school.

Nastorio is a tea farmer who started tea farming in 2003. Farming is his sole source of income, and he gives it an average of six hours per day. The farm is located in rural Ishaka, Bushenyi. He started the business with the purpose of getting a clear source of income so he could educate his children. 

Nastorio would like to use the loan money to buy fertilizers to put in his tea garden so that it will yield more and hence produce more income, enough money to educate his children. His major clients are the tea traders in his local area. His major challenges include seasons, which change unexpectedly and affect the quantities he harvests. However, he has hopes that the loan he gets (3,000,000 UGX) will boost his business and help him achieve his goal in life.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko is 54 years old. She is widowed and lives alone in the Lagodekhi district. The only source of income for her is a little social assistance (nearly 36 USD) from the local government, as she lives below the poverty line. Dariko requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and her poor living conditions. 

Dariko requested a loan from Credo to start an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved within the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Dariko will purchase two calves. After purchasing livestock, she will raise them and sell them in the spring for a higher price. It will generate an income and the new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
