Almira has an average monthly income in the amount of 20,000 KGS. Because of her hard work in the business the spouses where able to buy a store in the town's center. With the goal to further grow and expand their business Almira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som to increase the sale of goods. Almira plans to invest the income from the loan into growth and expansion of her business and also improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones in wholesale for resale.

loans.name: Bibiasmoa

texts.ru:
Бибиасмоа женщина с доброй душой. Она стремится к светлому будущему и верит в лучшее. Ей 37 лет, она живет с мужем и детьми в маленьком районе Кумсангир. Ее дети это смысл всей ее жизни. Все что она делает все ради них. Бибиасмоа опытный скотовод. Она в течение 10 лет разводит крупнорогатый скот мясной и молочной породы для дальнейшей продажи. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве только одна корова с теленком. Ей нужно увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом. 
Бибиасмоа за счет прибыли хочет отремонтировать свой дом и сыграть свадьбу старшего сына. Она мечтает принять в дом невестку и увидеть лица внуков.
texts.en:
Bibiasmoa is a woman with a kind soul. She seeks to have a bright future and believes in good. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in a small region of Kumsangir. Her children are the meaning of all of her life. Everything she does is for their sake. Bibiasmoa is an experienced cattle keeper. During the ten years she has been breeding large horned cattle for meat and milk and future resale. Right now there's only one cow and a calf in her business. She needs to increase the headcount of cattle and grow her business. She has come for a loan with this purpose.

Bibiasmoa wants to repair her home and hold a wedding for her oldest son using the profit. She dreams to accept her daughter-in-law into her home and see the faces of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy six heads of large horned cattle and increase the headcount of livestock and growth of business.

loans.name: Emmelyn

texts.en:
Emmelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional root crops to sell for her business.

Emmelyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from a general store and food-vending.

Emmelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional root crops to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in the construction business, specializing in cement work, for the past seven years. 

Mohamad is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into developing and expanding his business. To widen his working zone, Mohamad needs a car to facilitate his transportation and transport his tools from one place to another. For this reason, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car that will facilitate his business transportation and expand his working zone.

Mohamad hopes to keep on supporting and expanding his business in a well-managed way.

loans.use: To buy a car to facilitate his transportation and transport his tools from one place to another.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia, a sus 34 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Inició su propio negocio con el interés de generar sus ingresos por cuenta propia, por esta razón montó una papelería y café internet, aprovechando la ventaja de estar ubicado frente a un colegio; trabaja sola todos los días de la semana de 7:00 am a 6:00 pm, desde hace 3 años. Así ha logrado obtener los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía del hogar. La cliente es una mujer luchadora y enérgica, trabaja con dedicación y mucho esfuerzo para darle a sus hijos el mejor bienestar posible. Actualmente solicita el crédito con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (vitrina y estantería) y surtido (cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, block, cartulina, carpetas, colores, entre otros), esto le permitirá cambiar la imagen de su negocio para que permita atraer más clientes, además tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer la demanda y los diversos gustos de la clientela; de esta manera Nidia espera poder aumentar sus ventas y poder avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es ser reconocida en el sector por la calidad y el buen servicio que presta, así podrá fortalecer su negocio y tendrá la solvencia económica para brindar a sus hijos una excelente educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nidia, 34, has two children and lives with her partner. She wanted to start a business to generate her own income and three years ago she opened a stationery store / internet cafe, taking advantage of the location opposite a school. She works alone every day of the week from 7am to 6pm. Nidia has managed to obtain the resources necessary for her to contribute to their household economy. 

She is a feisty and energetic woman, who is dedicated to her business and works hard to give her children the best possible comfort. Nidia is currently seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of fixed assets (cabinets and shelves) and stock (notebooks, pens, markers, blocks, cardboard, binders, crayons, etc.). This will allow her to transform the image of her business and help attract more customers. She will also offer a wider variety of products to meet the demand and diverse tastes of her customers.

Nidia hopes to increase her sales and progress toward achieving her greatest dream, which is to be recognized in the industry for providing high quality and good service. She wants to strengthen her business and build the financial ability to give her children an excellent education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (cabinets & shelves) and stock (notebooks, pens, markers, blocks, cardboard, binders, crayons, etc.)

loans.name: Jenepher

texts.en:
Jenepher is 36 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenepher has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco for resell.

Jenepher has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jenepher would like to save enough money so she can rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for resell.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Gilma tiene 65 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y lamentablemente quedó viuda tras el fallecimiento de su esposo hace algunos años. Toda su vida productiva la dedicó a trabajar en el campo de las confecciones, como empleada en diversas empresas y luego de jubilarse, montó su propio negocio con la idea de seguir generando ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar y para estar siempre ocupada sintiéndose útil. Inició una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en la casa donde vive, allí atiende de Lunes a Domingo, aprovechando que vive en una zona residencial y tiene muchos clientes. 
Gilma es una señora pujante y trabajadora, manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir trabajando, además es apasionada por su labor, pues disfruta más la vida sintiéndose útil. Ella solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor ( (productos lácteos, galletería, huevos, granos, productos de aseo, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades; esto se reflejará en el aumento de sus ventas y de sus ingresos, con lo que podrá seguir pagando sus gastos mensuales y además tendrá la posibilidad de darle continuidad y acreditación a su negocio y generando más ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y su bienestar personal.
texts.en:
Gilma, 65, has three children. Unfortunately, she became a widow some years ago. She worked all her life for different companies in the clothing industry. When she retired, she started a business with the intention to continue generating income to cover the home expenses and to have an activity that would make her feel busy and useful. She opened a grocery store at home. She works Monday to Sunday; she has many customers and makes the most of her location in a residential area.

Gilma is a persistent and hardworking woman. She says that her age is not an obstacle for her to continue working. Besides, she is passionate about her job and feeling useful makes her enjoy life more. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (dairy products, cookies, eggs, grains, cleaning products, etc.). This way, she will have a wider variety to offer her customers and satisfy their needs and tastes. This will result in more sales and a better income, which will help her cover her monthly expenses. She will also be able to continue working with her business and to improve its reputation. A higher income means well-being and better living conditions for her.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as dairy products, cookies, eggs, grains and cleaning products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
A married mother of three, 40-year-old Lydia resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia, Liberia  It is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County and has one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 


Lydia runs a table business selling lappa (African clothes mostly used by women) in the local market.  Describing herself as a serious businesswoman, she started her enterprise two years ago, using money given by her mother.  Lydia typically works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. from Monday to Saturday, transporting her goods to the market by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as small capital reserves. 



Proud of her business because it supports her home, Lydia has requested this loan to purchase more lappa to resell.  In the future, she plans to build her house.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (women's clothes) to resell.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Amélé est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille à Lomé. Pour apporter sa contribution financière aux charges du ménage, elle a entamé le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle a ouvert à cet effet une boutique, elle s'approvisionne à Lomé. Son stock est en baisse et voudrait s'approvisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. Elle voudrait assurer l’éducation de ses enfants et créer d’autres boutiques.
texts.en:
Amélé is a married mother of two children. She lives with her family in Lomé. To make a financial contribution to household expenses, she began trading grocery products, and opened a shop to that effect. She gets her supplies in Lome.

Her stock supply is decreasing and she would like to resupply, which is why she is requesting a third loan from WAGES to purchase various grocery products.

She would like to ensure her children's education and open up other shops.

loans.use: Buy grocery items

loans.name: Mayliah

texts.en: Mayliah is 30 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 2 and 10. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo Western, a rural area in Sierra Leone. One of her children is going to school. She's been in this business since 2008, and she sells rubber bowls, sets of pans, and plates in her community. She says that the main problem with her business is its improper business location. Mayliah applied for this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more rubber bowls and sets of pans and a variety of food containers for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber bowls and sets of pans and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en: Simion is a 65-year-old business man. He is married to Jacinta. They are blessed with eleven grown-up children. Simon has been selling charcoal for the past 44 years and has a monthly income of KES 33,800, which he uses to support his family. Simion also doubles as a seller of cereals, a business which supplements his income.  Simion is applying for his first loan from KADET, after having been introduced by an existing KADET client. He will use the loan to buy more charcoal. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will raise the living standards of his family. His hopes and dreams are to run a successful charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice. Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell. Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 48 years old, and she operates a table in the market selling goods, including oil, rice, coal and pepper, in the Paynesville South area of Liberia. It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most heavily populated areas in Montserrado County. The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county, with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. She is married and has seven children between 20 and 33 years old. For the past two years, she has been in this business. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because it earns her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 AM to 4 PM. She is applying for a loan to buy more goods to sell in her business, such as oil, rice, coal and pepper. She plans to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as oil, rice, coal and pepper.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is a 28-year-old married father of three children who works as a barber to make a  living and provide his family with a good standard of living. Maher is not a Lebanese citizen. He is a nomadic Arab of unspecified nationality, like others living in Lebanon whose ancestors came to Lebanon illegally a long time ago and didn't register with the Lebanese government. He can't benefit from any official Lebanese governmental jobs or formal working sectors, but he can do his job and live freely in Lebanon, since he is not making any trouble. Maher is well known in his region, with a good reputation and special experience in his domain, which is why he intends to expand his business by acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase the number of beauty products he offers and to begin offering special men’s facial treatments. He hopes to keep on developing his business, because it is the only thing he is experienced in doing, and it is very important for his family's education and lifestyle.

loans.use: to expand his business by increasing the number of beauty products he offers and beginning to offer special men's facial treatments.

loans.name: Rihana

texts.en: Rihana is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons and elastic, to meet the increasing demand of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors, zippers, buttons, and elastic.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, age 49, is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She has eight years of experience in this field. She offers a variety of groceries and stationery. She has built up a regular list of customers and makes enough to support her family. She wants to grow her business, so she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of biscuits, oil and beverages, as well as packets of paper and pens. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of biscuits, oil and beverages, as well as packets of copies and pens, for her store.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and raises them, and then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business. Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid lives with his wife and their two children. For the last two years, Vahid has earned a living growing and selling tomatoes and cucumbers. He sells the plants in the market, which is near his home, and is able to cover some of his household expenses with the profits he makes. Vahid is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, tomato seedlings and the like, so he can continue with his crops, which are his only source of work. This will give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, tomato seedlings and the like for his business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 40 years old, married, and has five children.  She is from the Jui eastern area in Freetown. In 2003, Marie established her local food business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family's welfare.   She works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Marie is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, sweet potatoes, and bananas

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 19-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for the past three years with ten years of experience in this domain. He didn't continue his school studies because of his family's needs for a breadwinner.
 
Through his previous loan, he increased the stock of hair treatments, creams, facials and after shaves to provide a wide variety for his customers to buy. These products were an extra source of income he relied on a lot in addition to what he gets for haircuts. 

His customers are mostly his friends, neighbors and relatives. He is working hard to keep on expanding and developing his working through opening a wider beauty therapy salon specializing in men’s facial treatments.

He is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into improving and expanding his business, to make sure that his customers are pleased. Ali is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do special electricity maintenance to his shop and his house.

loans.use: To do special electricity maintenance to his shop and his house

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

Fifteen years ago she decided to start a stitching business at her home to meet her household expenditures. She is expert in stitching fine clothes. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She contacted to Kashf Foundation for loan of PKR 35,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces and zippers. It’s her third year with Kahf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors and packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is motivated to provide all life’s conveniences to her family members. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She offers variety of goods for daily use, including groceries and cleaning products. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store, and she makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store better stocked, she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy grains, oil and sugar. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains, oil and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children. 

Five years ago, she started a business selling clothes. By this time, she has become famous among her neighbors for her collections and she has a good client list. 

Currently, she availed herself of a second loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase good-quality clothes, in different colors and designs. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would help her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes, in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shura

texts.en:
Shura is a widow and works hard to cover her family's basic costs. She is a devoted mother and grandmother from Zartonq village. 

She lives with her family and is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cows and pigs and cultivates tomato and eggplant. The gathered harvest she sells in local markets and gets income that is very important for her family's living.
 
By applying for this loan, Shura wants to purchase forage for feeding her livestock. The grass that she cultivates is not enough for feeding animals, so she needs to purchase forage.

Shura is sure that years of hard work will bring her the farm of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Rutooma Women Group

texts.en:
Ajjara is 45 years old. Her husband divorced her and left her with three children to look after. From her hard work she has managed to educate her children. Some of the children have reached secondary level. 

She has been dealing in a retail shop and has a banana plantation to add to her income.

She has requested the loan to continue educating her children and to buy insecticides for her banana plantation. She took a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her to top up on school fees and buy some insecticide.    

Her major challenge is banana wilts, which destroy her plantation, and the competition in retail is stiff, so it does not yield much in terms of income to sustain the family needs.     

Her major dream is to restore back her banana plantation, which is almost getting finished due to wilt, by pruning and planting fresh wilt-free  bananas.

loans.use: To top up on the children's tuition. and buy insecticides.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is quite a motivated woman and always wants to do something for the betterment of her family. She has only one child who is school-going. 

Four years ago, she initiated her business of cloth sales. She buys cloths of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money through her business. 

Fareeda is requesting a PKR 35,000 loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. Fareeda expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Farhat dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en:
Karmen is farmer from Baghramyan village, where she lives with her husband and son. Karmen's husband receives a pension and helps Karmen with running a farm. They cultivate haricot and peppers, and sell the gathered harvest in the local markets.

Karmen is very skilled in the agricultural sphere, but because of financial hardships she isn’t able to cultivate different types of vegetables. She has applied for this loan to purchase land and be able to enlarge this farm. Karmen will also purchase fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of the land.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her to improve her farm and gather more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
The group is called "Edith's Group" and it is composed of five women entrepreneurs who are seeking better opportunities to move on in life. They live in the city of Accra, a beautiful place where trading is very popular and well established.

They sell bags, plantain, charcoal, jeans, underwear and jewelry.

This is their first loan with Kiva and the fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

One of the members, Edith, has been in the group for the past three years and has established a good friendship with all her neighbors and friends. She likes the fact that all the members of the group are united and much like a family.

Edith, 51, is married and has three dependent children who are staying with them. She rents the house she lives in and her husband is a businessman who works so hard to support her.

For five years, Edith has been selling bags. She sells throughout the week by walking to her customers.

She plans to use the new loan amount of GHS 1,400 to buy bags so that she can sell enough to take care of her children. Her goal is to stay healthy so she can keep working to take care of her children.
 
They need a total loan amount of GHS 3,250 to buy more stock for sale.

They are demonstrating samples of their products in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy bags to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a  60-year-old, married father of four, from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his third loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully repaying his previous loans. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET, he will be able to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer. Additional income created will allow him to cater to his family’s needs and to repay his loan. 

In the future, Peter would like to purchase a piece of land and to construct a permanent, residential house. He hopes to start exporting his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 27 years old and not yet married. He has a cereal business in Naivasha, which he has operated for one year, and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to purchase maize and beans. He plans to expand his business with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Peter hopes to become the biggest cereal supplier in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka, a 64-year-old father of four from Mwingi, has a business as a livestock farmer. He is married to Lilian, who helps him in animal rearing. He earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), which he uses to support his family. This marks his first loan term with KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD., he will be able to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for rearing. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Musyoka would like to venture into mixed-crop farming and also expand his animals’ sheds. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys for rearing.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen, age 40, is a married woman and a mother of five children. She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Yasmeen started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family's income. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Yasmeen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, with packs of buttons, needles, and elastics. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers, without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, with packs of buttons, needles, and elastics.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 23-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Rubina wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. She has been doing a business of tailoring since five years ago to support her husband financially. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Gulshan hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of packs of buttons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru: Мамагул сельская женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она живет с мужем и четырьмя детьми в районе Пяндж. Мамагул арендует земельный участок, где выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она занимается растениеводством в течение 5 лет. Мамагул в основном выращивает огородные культуры. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения семян картофеля и минеральных удобрений. Мамагул осенью хочет собрать хороший урожай картофеля и заработать хороший доход, так как в это время все жители делают запасы на зиму. Она верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamagul is a country woman of 47. She lives with her husband and four children in the Pyandj region. Mamagul leases a plot of land where she grows agricultural crops. She has been working with this type of farming for five years. 

Mamagul primarily grows market crops and is requesting a loan to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers with the intention of harvesting a good crop of potatoes in the fall and earning good profits, since at this time everybody is stocking up for the winter. She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Nasra, from Tujijenge, Tanzania, was born in the early 1970s and has one son and one daughter who are in school. 

For six years now, Nasra has been running different activities: a shop selling dry food, selling charcoal and also offering tap-water service. She is doing fine with her businesses. Nasra works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month.
 
This is her sixth loan request. She will use it to buy more foods and charcoal to resell. With the previous loans, she bought more shop foods, charcoal, a fridge and one tank for water storage. She used her profit to cover school fees and home expenses and to buy a house fridge. Nasra dreams that one day will be able to own a hardware store and build a house.
 
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Compressor," which consist of 13 members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more foods and charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Fatmata from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 years and 21 years.  In 2003, Fatmata established her cookery business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation, and sometimes if the food is not finished, it will spoil.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase rice, onions and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, onions and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a married woman and a mother of four children. She is 42 years old and has been involved in a bangles sales business for the past twelve years. She serves her community well. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  Now she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a great variety of bangles in different colors and designs. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her sales and wishes to spend part of her profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to buy a great variety of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for the past four years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices and brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase two more goats. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing her family with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sabaan

texts.en:
Sabaan is a 38 year old married woman who has been doing a business of milk sales for the past five years. She has one buffalo and one cow in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has five children and all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

She has some past savings and requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to increase the production of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Muthoka

texts.en: Muthoka is 23 years old, and she lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last two months, Muthoka has been operating a shop which supplies cooking gas to the locals. She knew Milango through friends, and now, she seeks a loan to buy more gas cylinders for sale. Her husband is employed, and he supports her, too, in the business. The challenge in the business is the low season, and the income raised will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Abibatu is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 7 years and 18 years. She runs a general store in Jui, eastern area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Abibatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Munisa

texts.ru: Муниса трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Ее муж добрый человек, но не может обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Муниса планирует организовать свой бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей канцелярских товаров. Она живет в сельской местности и поэтому она вполне может развевать свой бизнес, так как нет большой конкуренции. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1500 сомони для покупки канцелярских товаров, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munisa is a hardworking and conscientious woman of 30. She is married and raising two young children. He husband is a good man but unable to provide his family with everything they need. Munisa plans to start her own business. With this goal in mind she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to start a business buying and selling office supplies. She lives in a rural area where there is little competition and therefore has great potential to develop her business. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy office supplies to launch her business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy office supplies to start a new business

loans.name: Jhoana Alejandra

texts.es: Jhoana tiene 28 años de edad y toda su vida vivió con sus abuelos maternos, quienes la criaron y le brindaron todo lo necesario para que fuera una mujer de bien. Hace 4 años su abuela falleció y quedó sola con su abuelo, quien más adelante volvió a casarse, por lo que vio la necesidad de buscar opciones para generar ingresos y poder independizarse. Esto la llevó a comenzar su propio negocio, vendiendo mercancía como zapatos, blusas, jeans, entre otros. En vista de que le estaba yendo muy bien con las ventas, decidió montar su negocio en un local, para lo cual contó con unos ahorros que su abuela le había dejado como herencia y hoy en día ya es reconocido en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado. La cliente es una mujer emprendedora, pujante, con visión y muchas ganas de progresar, eso la motiva a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor, especialmente sandalias y zapatos tipo baleta, con lo cual podrá ampliar su portafolio de productos y así satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos. Esto la impulsará para cumplir su principal sueño que es acreditar bien su negocio y generar oportunidades de empleo, con lo cual podrá mejorar no solo su calidad de vida, sino la de muchas otras personas.
texts.en:
Jhoana is 28 years old and has live her whole life with her maternal grandparents who have raised her and provided her with all the necessities to be a good woman. Four years ago her grandmother passed away and she was left with her grandfather who later remarried. She saw the necessity to look for options to generate income and to be able to become independent. This led her to start her own business, selling merchandise such as shoes, blouses, jeans etc... Since she was doing very well with sales, she decided to set her business up on a premise, for which she used savings that her grandmother had left her as inheritance. Nowadays she is already known in the area where she is located. 

The client is an enterprising and strong woman with visions and much desire to progress. This is what inspires her to ask for a loan. To invest it in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale, especially sandals and shoes (flats), with which she will be able to expand her products and thus satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers. This will be reflected in the increase in her sales and income. 

This will drive her to fulfill her dream which is for her business to be well known and to generate employment opportunities, with which she will be able to improve not only her quality of life but of many others.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise at wholesale, (sandals and shoes (flats)).

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TERIYA ont en moyenne 45  ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA  chef lieu du cercle de SAN de la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de produits alimentaires tels les condiments alimentaires les fruits et légumes et de produits divers.
les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur 10 eme prêt solidaire les prêts précédents ont été correctement  remboursé. 
FOUNE  1 ère femme assise de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de petit mil, du sucre et du sel pour la préparation du Takoula qu’elle fait tous les vendredis. Le Takoula est une sorte de gâteau traditionnel à usage multiples.
Elle s’approvisionne dans  les villages environnants et à Koutiala. Elles effectuent ses ventes en faisant l’ambulant  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 49000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Teriya group are on average 45 years old with six children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana, capital of the SAN district,  fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

These women became acquainted through kinship and are involved in commercial activities such as the retail trading of condiments, fruits and vegetables, and other products. The women in the Teriya group are on their 10th group loan and previous loans have been fully repaid.

Foune is the first woman sitting from right to left on the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy bags of millet, sugar and salt to prepare takoula, which she does every Friday. Takoula is a kind of traditional multi-purpose cake.

She gets her supplies from surrounding villages and from Koutiala. She conducts her sales as an itinerant street vendor to a clientele composed of women and men.

She expects to make average monthly profits of 49,000 FCFA she will spend on health, food, and tuition fees. The remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make takoula

loans.name: Guicela

texts.es: Guísela, de 30 años, está casada y es madre de dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Guisela consiste en la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, entre otros, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida por la situación que pasaba la ciudad por el terrorismo, pero desde hace 10 años decidió empezar con este negocio. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen un ingreso estable para su hogar. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, huevos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Guisela, age 30, is married and the mother of two children with whom she lives in her own home. Guisela’s job consists of the sale of groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, and eggs, among others. For a long time, she suffered many setbacks in her life due to the situation with terrorism in her city, but ten years ago she decided to begin this business. She likes what she does, because it allows her to have time to be able to take care of her home. In addition, since starting her business, things have been going well for her economically, since they have a stable income for their household. 

This is her first loan with Kiva; she is expecting this contribution in order to continue with her goals. She is committed to making her payments punctually. With the requested amount of 1,000 soles, she will buy groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, eggs, and others.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima, age 24, has had a milk selling business for many years with the support of her husband. Over that time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo. In this way she will be able to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mabinty from Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 12 and 25 years. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 2007, Mabinty established her local food business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy cassava and banana to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and change her status of living. In the future; Mabitny plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cassava and banana to expand her business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old single man who started his own shoe-selling business nine months ago to improve the living standards of the four family members for whom he is the sole breadwinner.


Mohamad is a hard worker with a very good reputation in his region, although at the start he had small financial problems that interfered with his business development and expansion plans. Today, however, he is working hard to improve and expand his enterprise in a well-managed way to ensure sustainability. He is now requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with newly-released collections to fulfill his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly-released collections

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. Gloria has been in this business for 40 years. Gloria earns more income from raising pigs. Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Aminata, from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child, seven years old.  

In 2010, Aminata established her cookery business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in business. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that it is difficult to find time to prepare the cookery.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasoning, and palm oil, to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and to increase her business. 

In the future, Aminata plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasoning, and palm oil, to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the featured borrower of this group. She is standing on the left. Rebecca is a 39-year-old mother of one child. She has been operating a hair dressing salon for the past seven years.

Rebecca will use her portion of the loan to purchase wigs that she will use on her customers who come to her salon. She also sells cosmetics and will use her loan to update her stock. In the future, Rebecca hopes to operate the biggest beauty salon in her area. Her friend sells fish.

loans.use: To purchase wigs that she will use on her customers who come to her salon.

loans.name: Les Rachets De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Filsaime habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années, Il est le boulanger et a une boulangerie. 

Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat de la farine, le beurre, les œufs, entre autres produits. Filsaime espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Il est marié il a 15 enfants. Il est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Rachetes de Dilaire. 

Des autres membres de Les Rachetes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Filsaime dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant . Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les pains.
texts.en:
Filsaime lives in the town of Trou du Nord in Haiti, where electricity is scarce and water supplies are very limited. He is a baker, and he has been running his own bakery for six years. He wants to use this loan to stock up on flour, butter, eggs, and other baking products. He hopes that this loan will help him to achieve his goal of expanding his business. 

Filsaime has stated that his main challenge is the lack or repeat customers. His main objective is to bolster his activity, and his dream is to buy a motorcycle to deliver his baked goods.

Filsaime is married with 15 children, and he is the coordinator of the group “Les Rachets de Dilaire”. The other group members are seeking loans for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, rice or fish.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs, and other baking supplies

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSO commune de BOUGOURA  cercle  de BLA  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4er prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  KOTIMI,  1 ere femme  debout de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à YANGASSO, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi 2" are married women, who average 35 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in DJIGONSO,  in Commune de BOUGOURA, Cercle de BLA, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry  out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with KOTIMI, who is standing first from the right. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain 1.25 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in YANGASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 145,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to purchase farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 41ans, Komlan aime rendre belle toute personne. Il a ouvert son salon de couture et en même temps vend des habits cousus. Il est papa de 02 enfants et sa femme est revendeuse. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits de mercerie. Il a une ambition devenir un couturier de renom et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
A young 41-year-old man, Komlan loves to make everyone beautiful. He opened a tailor shop where he also sells sewn clothing. He is the father of two children and his wife is a retailer.

He is requesting this loan to buy haberdashery goods. His ambition is to become a renowned tailor and ensure his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and pagnes (a type of West African cloth).

loans.name: Shirak

texts.en:
Shirak is from Jrarat village of the Armavir region. Shirak has been working at South Caucasus Railway for many years, but the main activity that he does with love and care is running a farm. Currently he cultivates cucumber, tomato, pepper, and eggplant. Shirak sells the gathered harvest in the city market and earns income for his family.

Shirak owns a greenhouse that is too old and needs to be renovated. Shirak isn't able to renovate it and cultivate more fruits and vegetables, because of financial hardships. Shirak requests a loan for renovating his greenhouse and expanding the cultivation process. The loan is very important for this hard working grandfather of two children.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children aged 4 years and 8 years old.  In 2010, Jariatu established her food stuffs business. She began her business because it is the thing she understands best.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to operate her business.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasoning, and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasoning, and palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Edzona

texts.fr: Edzona vit avec son conjoint chauffeur et son enfant de 02ans à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale. Aidée par 01 personne, elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère ouvrir une boutique et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Edzona est âgée de 34ans avec une ancienneté de 02ans.
texts.en: Edzona lives with her husband, a driver, and her 2-year-old child in Lomé. She is retail grocer. Helped by one person, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase more merchandise. She hopes to open a shop and ensure self-sufficiency in food for the family. Edzona is 34 years old and has two years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJIGONSO commune de BOUGOURA  cercle  de BLA 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec  RACHELLE, 1 ere  femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à YANGASSO, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 130.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi 1" are married women, who average 45 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in DJIGONSO,  in Commune de BOUGOURA, Cercle de BLA, in the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry  out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with RACHELLE, who is sitting first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village and in YANGASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 130,000 francs CFA at the end of planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to purchase farm inputs, tools, and seeds

loans.name: Yosinta

texts.en: Yosinta is a 31 year old married woman with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods alongside running a bar in order to boost her income. She faces challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital. However, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Yosinta intends to use the loan to buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Odilia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace tres años se vio en la necesidad de iniciar un negocio para generar ingresos para su familia. Tiene una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, azúcar, manteca, maíz, frijoles, condimentos, medicamentos, refrescos y otros. Ha decidido solicitar el tercer préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras, que también lo va invertir en surtir el negocio, va comprar granos básicos, manteca, medicamentos, refrescos, harina, azúcar, etc. Con el fin de ver bien surtido y poder aumentar las ventas. Su meta es obtener ingresos que le permitan ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen los estudios.
texts.en:
María is 48 and married with two children. She lives in the Tela municipality of Atlántida. Three years ago she saw the need to start a business to earn an income for her family. She has a grocery store where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, lard, corn, beans, condiments, medicine, soft drinks, among other things. 

She has decided to request her third loan, which is for 25,000 Honduran Lempiras, that she will also invest in stocking her business. She is going to purchase basic grains, lard, medicine, soft drinks, flour, sugar, etc. She plans to have her business well stocked so she can increase sales. Her goal is to have an income that she can use to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: purchase stock for the grocery store such as basic grains, lard, medicine, drinks, flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Merardo

texts.es: Merardo, tiene  51  años de edad, esta soltero y vive  con una hermana en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida. Anteriormente realizaba trabajos de agricultura y hace 22 años inicio a reparar bicicletas logrando establecer su propio taller. Presta el servicio de reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicleta.   Para mantener el negocio activo ha solicitado varios préstamos en ODEF, actualmente solicita el quinto ciclo el cual es por  10,000 lempiras para la compra de repuestos como ser neumáticos, monturas, parches, rines, y otros repuestos de bicicleta tanto para la reparación como para  la venta. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos y espera mejorar su situación económica, también poder obtener los ingresos necesarios para su manutención.
texts.en:
Merardo is 51 years old. He is single and lives with a sister in the municipality of Arizona Atlántida. He previously worked in agriculture and began repairing bicycles 22 years ago. He was able to set up his own workshop, where he provides repair services and sells parts for bicycles. 

To keep his business running he has applied for various loans with ODEF. At present he is requesting a fifth loan cycle for 10,000 lempiras in order to purchase replacement parts such as tires, patches, rims, saddles and other parts for use in repair as well as selling spare parts. This business is his source of income. He hopes to earn enough to be able to maintain it and to improve his economic situation.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts such as tires, patches, rims, saddles and others for repairing bicycles and selling spare parts.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Isatu from Jui, an eastern area of Freetown. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 13. 

In 2003, Isatu established her local food stock business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family welfare. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase corn and groundnut (peanuts) to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase corn and groundnut to expand her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old, married to Esther, and they have three children who are in school.

He has a mechanic business in Naivasha which he has operated for ten years and has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy building materials for his house.

In the near future, Peter hopes to expand his garage to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 4 and 15. She runs a general store in Jui, in the eastern area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is the lack of capital for expansion.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Don Germán  de 33 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia,  es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable pues día con día  lucha  por el pan diario para su familia  desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura principal menta a la siembra de maíz y frijol,  Germán esta solicitando un crédito  para la compra  de insumos  agrícolas como abono, herbecidas , insecticidas, semillas, fertilizantes y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra, de esa manera  quiere mejorar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Germán is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He is a hardworking and responsible man who strives day after day to provide for the daily needs of his family. Germán has been farming for 15 years, mainly growing corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies such as compost, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers in order to improve the land on which he will be planting his crops. This will help to improve his income and allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es: Doña Ana de 42 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia  con sus tres hijos, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de  ropa para damas y caballeros, es una persona  amable responsable  y muy trabajadora  se esfuerza al máximo  ya que es una mujer viuda es por ello que tiene que luchar a diario  para poder llevar el sustento a sus hijos,  los clientes la buscan por su amabilidad a la hora de vender, doña Ana solicita  un crédito  para poder invertirlo en mas mercaderia como: faldas, blusas, camisas, short, pantalon, etc. y así mejorar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana is 42 years old and is a single mother living in her own home with her three children. For several years she has been selling women's and men's clothing. She is a kind and responsible person, is very hard-working, and puts forth a lot of effort since she is a widow and has to fight daily in order to be able to provide for her children. Her customers seek her out because of her friendliness. 

Ms. Ana is applying for a loan in order to invest in more merchandise such as skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, pants, etc. and thus increase her profits and be able to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Afin des matières premières pour répondre aux besoins des clients, Yao bijoutier de profession sollicite un quatrième crédit à WAGES. Âgé de 35ans, il est marié à une coiffeuse et exerce cette activité depuis 2003. Il espère agrandir son activité et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: To purchase raw materials in order to meet customer needs, Yao, a jeweler by trade, is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES. He is 35 years old and married to a hairstylist. He has been operating his business since 2003. He hopes to expand this business and to ensure that his family thrives.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is 38 years old and married to Lucy. They have three children who are in school. He has practiced farming in Naivasha for three years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him purchase fertilizer and seeds. He plans to pay school fees with anticipated profit. In the near future, Justus hopes to be among the top farmers in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Savata

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Savata from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has one two-year-old child. In 2010, Savata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to operate her business.

Savata requires a loan in order to purchase slippers and clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Savata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is a hardworking woman with four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a restaurant. To earn additional income, she also has a lodge. She faces hardships of customers who delay in paying, theft, and the high cost of rent. 

Molly is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay school fees for her children.  She has a vision of building her own business premises in order to reduce her rental expenses.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Rugiatu from Tombo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 2 children between the ages of 7 years and 12 years. Her children are attending school. 

Rugiatu runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, onions, and cooking season. She started running this business just after her wedding. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Rugiatu says that the main challenges to her business are prices, transportation, and insufficient financing to expand her business.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions, and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking item like rice, onions, and cooking seasoning

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 40-year-old, hard-working woman with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Her main business is selling cultural instruments.The seasonal nature of the business is her greatest challenge, while her dream is to diversify her business to include crafts and to educate her children up to the University.

Rosemary intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE représente le groupe BADEYA. Elle se porte bien et viens d’avoir son quatrième enfant. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 02mois. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’atiéké) depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de KILWIN. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier (hommes, femmes et enfants).
Elle veut s’acheter 10sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc), 01bidon d’huile et 01sachet de poisson frais.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. SOLANGE represents the group BADEYA. She is doing well and has just had her fourth child. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 18 years old, and the youngest is 2 months old. The three attend school.  

Ms. SOLANGE is in the restaurant business (selling atiéké, a kind of couscous made from fermented cassava meal) for ten years. She gets her supplies from the KILWIN market. Her customers are the inhabitants of the district (men, women, and children). She wants to purchase 10 bags of atiéké (cassava couscous), a container of oil, and a bag of fresh fish.

With the profits, she would like to bolster her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cassava couscous, oil, and fresh fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in the Kilifi area, miles from Mombasa, in Kenya. He is 28 years old and a single man. 

He has been running a retail shop for the last two years. He started the business from savings that he had made. He wants the business to grow into a wholesale business in the next five years. The challenges in the business are the instability in prices and inflation. 

Michael knew of Milango Financial Services through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice, and beans to sell. The extra income that he raises will be reinvested in the business, until the business is stable enough.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar, tiene  54 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura  al cultivo de maíz y frijoles.  Hace 15 años que inicio con el cultivo de arroz y le ha ido muy bien. Ha invertido 8 prestamos anteriores, el actual es el noveno ciclo el cual es por 15,000 Lempiras,  y lo va utilizar para la preparación de cuatro manzanas de tierra para fertilizar, limpiar y en la siembra de arroz.  El espera poderle dar un buen mantenimiento al cultivo y obtener la producción de calidad. Su meta es trabajar duro para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Baltazar is 54 years old, married, and has four children. He lives in the town of Trujillo, Colon.

Baltazar has always been a farmer, planting corn and beans. He began planting rice 15 years ago and did very well. Baltazar has invested eight previous loans. His current one is his ninth loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL. The money will be used to prepare four plots of land by fertilizing and clearing them so that he can plant rice. He hopes to maintain his crops well so that he can obtain a quality product. His goal is to work hard so that he can get ahead along with his family.

loans.use: to pay the cost of fertilizing and clearing four plots of land for planting rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale (shoes, cosmetic products, etc.)

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena ella es casada y tiene 40 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno y sopas,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para cocinar como arroz, pollo, carne y verduras.

El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de morayas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Qorilazo.” This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The featured borrower is Ms. Elena. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She works in her business of food sales. She prepares dishes such as baked chicken and soups, and then she sells her food as a street vendor in the different streets of the city of Cusco. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. She has been doing this job for 6 years and it is going really well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting the loan to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, chicken, beef, and vegetables.
